items.title: South Koreans Are Among Hundreds Detained in Immigration Raid at Hyundai E.V. Plant
items.summary: Executives of a South Korean battery maker were apprehended at a construction site in Georgia, the company said. The episode prompted diplomatic concern in Seoul.

items.title: The Luckiest Gas Station in America
items.summary: A Syrian immigrant in Southern California beat the odds — twice — and now some Powerball players see an ineffable magic at work in his store.

items.title: ICE Agents Are Wearing Masks. Is That Un-American?
items.summary: The long, strange story of masking and law enforcement.

items.title: ‘Something Is Wrong With My Brain’: A Police Officer’s Descent
items.summary: Brent Simpson is the first police officer known to have C.T.E. He showed signs of the disease in the last few years of his life.

items.title: How a Top Secret SEAL Team 6 Mission Into North Korea Fell Apart
items.summary: The 2019 operation, greenlit by President Trump, sought a strategic edge. It left unarmed North Koreans dead.

items.title: The Secret Mission to Spy on North Korea’s Leader
items.summary: In 2019, a group of Navy SEALs crept out of the ocean onto the shore of North Korea for a dangerous and secret mission that has never been publicly disclosed until now.

items.title: Trump faces criticism over to order to rebrand Pentagon as ‘Department of War’ – US politics live
items.summary: <p>Move could cost tens of millions of dollars, with letterheads and signs needing to be changed, and one Democrat says money should instead go towards preventing conflicts</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/04/trump-defense-war-department">Trump expected to order rebrand of Pentagon as ‘Department of War’</a></p></li></ul><p><strong>Tensions between Michelle Wu, the mayor of Boston, and the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-administration">Trump administration</a> have been escalating in recent months over the administration’s aggressive immigration policies, with reports now signaling the possibility of a federal immigration enforcement surge in the city.</strong></p><p>The friction came to a head last week when the Trump administration reportedly began preparing an “immigration enforcement blitz” for Boston in the coming weeks, according to <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2025/08/29/trump-admin-plans-immigration-enforcement-surge-in-boston-00536276">Politico</a>.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/05/donald-trump-pentagon-department-of-war-immigration-tariffs-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: First Thing: RFK Jr accused of ‘reckless disregard for science and the truth’ in Senate hearing
items.summary: <p>Health secretary defends his leadership as Democrats attack his vaccine policy and demand his resignation. Plus, how Giorgio Armani became the mastermind of contemporary style</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/info/2018/sep/17/guardian-us-morning-briefing-sign-up-to-stay-informed">Don’t already get First Thing in your inbox? Sign up here</a></p></li></ul><p>Good morning.</p><p>The US health secretary, Robert F Kennedy Jr, faced the Senate finance committee in <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/04/rfk-jr-hearing-calls-resign-democrats">a tense and combative hearing</a> on Thursday, during which lawmakers questioned his remarks expressing vaccine skepticism, claims that the scientific community is deeply politicized, and the ongoing turmoil plaguing the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).</p><p><strong>What did the Democrats say during the hearing?</strong> Senators began by calling for Kennedy’s resignation. “Robert Kennedy’s primary interest is taking vaccines away from Americans,” the ranking member Ron Wyden said, while Raphael Warnock called Kennedy a “hazard to the health of the American people” and repeated his calls for him to step down or for Donald Trump to fire him.</p><p><strong>What did Trump say about the need for congressional approval?</strong> That the administration considered it a mere formality. “We’re just going to do it.
